aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects

Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.GameObject
      • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.Bullet

  • public class Bullet
extends GameObject
    The bullet is the ultimate weapon of the player. It has the same mechanics as an asteroid, in which it cannot divert from its trajectory. However, the bullet has the addition that it only exists for a certain amount of game steps.
    Author:
    Yannick Stoffers

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bullet

        public Bullet(java.awt.geom.Point2D location,
      double velocityX,
      double velocityY,
      Spaceship shooter)
        Constructs a new bullet using the given location and velocity parame- ters. The amount of steps the bullet gets to live is by default 60.
        Parameters:
        location - location of the bullet.
        velocityX - velocity of the bullet as projected on the X-axis.
        velocityY - velocity of the bullet as projected on the Y-axis.

    • Method Detail

      • nextStep

        public void nextStep()
        Method that determines the behaviour of the bullet. The behaviour of a bullet is defined by adding the velocity to its location parameters. The location is then restricted to values between 0 and 800 (size of the window).
        Overrides:
        nextStep in class GameObject

      • clone

        public Bullet clone()
        Clones the bullet into an exact copy. On the Server, includes the current shooter (the colour can be deduced from this) and the steps it should still live. On the client, includes the current colour.
        Specified by:
        clone in class GameObject

      • toJSON

        public org.json.simple.JSONArray toJSON()
        Overrides:
        toJSON in class GameObject
        Returns:
        a JSONArray containing the important characteristics of this Bullet (Besides the spatial information, this is the colour)
        See Also:
        GameObject.toJSON(), Bullet#fromJSON()

      • fromJSON

        public static Bullet fromJSON(org.json.simple.JSONArray json)
        Reconstructs a Bullet from the given JSONArray.
        See Also:
        toJSON()

      • getShooter

        public Spaceship getShooter()
        Returns:
        Returns the Spaceship that shot this Bullet, or `null` if this is not known.
        (Note that since this information is not passed to the Client, this will always return `null` on the client-side)

      • getColour

        public int getColour()
        Returns:
        the current Bullet's colour.

      • setColour

        public void setColour(int colour)
        Parameters:
        colour - A colour to set this Bullet's colour to.
